Parameters: String representing the name of the app.
setAppName(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the name of the App for analytics reports. This value is populated by default using the information provided by the android package manager.

setSessionTimeout(long).Description: Specify the time (in seconds) an app can stay in the background before a new session is started. Setting this to a negative number will result in a new session never being started. Default is 30 seconds.

Parameters: String representing the name of the app.
setAppId(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the id of the App for analytics reports. This value is populated by default using the information provided by the android package manager. This value is usually the package name used by the app.

setUseSecure(boolean).Description: Sets whether hits should be sent securely over https. The default value is true.

setCampaignParamsOnNextHit(android.net.U.Description: Includes the campaign parameters contained in the URI referrer in the next hit. If there is no referrer, or the referrer does not contain campaign parameters, this method does not add anything to the next hit. Use this method to track in-app events driven by advertising with deep linking campaigns. Valid campaign parameters are: utm_id utm_campaign utm_content utm_medium utm_source utm_term dclid gclid Example: http://my.site.com/index.html?referrer=utm_source%3Dsource%26utm_campaign%3Dwow

Parameters: string that denotes a particular language/locale.
setLanguage(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the language based on user's preferred locale. The string should be of the format ll-cc where ll is the language and cc is the country. If no value is provided, the default value from the android SDK is used.

setClientId(java.lang.String).Description: Sets a particular client Id for the device. This Id should be a valid UUID (version 4) string as described in http://goo.gl/0dlrGx. If not specified, the SDK automatically generates one for you and sets it.

Parameters: The key of the field that needs to be set. It starts with "&" followed by the parameter name. The complete list of fields can be found at http://goo.gl/M6dK2U.
A string value to be sent to Google servers. A null value denotes that the value should not be sent over wire.
set(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).Description: Sets the model value for the given key. All subsequent track or send calls will send this key-value pair along as well. To remove a particular field, simply set the value to null.
set(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).FullName: public void set (String key, String value)

Parameters: String representing the name of the app.
setAppInstallerId(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the Installer Id of the App for analytics reports. This value is populated by default using the information provided by the android package manager and the play store.

Parameters: true if the advertising information should be collected. False otherwise.
enableAdvertisingIdCollection(boolean).Description: Sets whether the advertising id and ad targeting preference should be collected while sending hits to GA servers. The collection of advertising id and the ad targeting preference is disabled by default and needs to be turned on for mobile audience features and any other features that require advertising id.

get(java.lang.String).Description: Gets the model value for the given key. Returns null if no model value has been set.

Parameters: integer representing the width in pixels.
integer representing the height in pixels.
setScreenResolution(int, int).Description: Sets the screen resolution of the device. If no resolution is specified, the default resolution from the android SDK is used.
setScreenResolution(int, int).FullName: public void setScreenResolution (int width, int height)

Parameters: A value between 0 and 100, specifying the percentage of devices that should send hits.
setSampleRate(double).Description: Set the sample rate for all hits generated by the app. The sampling is done at app level. The default value is 100. To enable sampling, the minimum rate required is 0.01%.

Parameters: String representing the version of the app.
setAppVersion(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the version identifier of the App for analytics reports. This value is populated by default using the information provided by the android package manager.

Parameters: True if screen views should be automatically generated.
enableAutoActivityTracking(boolean).Description: Specify whether @B_android#app#Activity_E@ starts should automatically generate screen views from this @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker_E@.

setScreenName(java.lang.String).Description: Set the screen name to be associated with all subsequent hits.

enableExceptionReporting(boolean).Description: Enables or disables uncaught exception reporting for a given tracker. This method is equivalent to using 'ga_reportUncaughtExceptions' in the tracker configuration file. Note that as with the configuration setting, only the uncaught exceptions are reported using this method.

Parameters: map of hit data to values which are merged with the existing values which are already set (using @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#set_E@). Values in this map will override the values set earlier. The values in this map will not be reused for the subsequent hits. If you need to send a value in multiple hits, you can use the @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#set_E@ method.
send(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, jav.Description: Merges the model values set on this Tracker via @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#send_E@ with params and generates a hit to be sent. The hit may not be dispatched immediately. Note that the hit type must set for the hit to be considered valid. More information on this can be found at http://goo.gl/HVIXHR.

ClassDesc: Composes and sends hits to Google Analytics. You can get an instance of this class by calling @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#GoogleAnalytics#newTracker_E@. A Tracker must be initialized with a tracking id of an app profile before you can send any hits. Use this class to set values for measurement protocol parameters using the provided set methods. A param value set using @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#set_E@ method is sent with all subsequent hits until you overwrite it with another value or clear it by setting it to null. You can also override it by specifying a different value in a @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#send_E@ call. The values passed in the @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#send_E@ are sent only with that hit. The following example uses the @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#HitBuilders#EventBuilder_E@ helper class to build a param map to pass to the @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker#send_E@ method. @B_com#google#android#gms#analytics#Tracker_E@ can also be initialized with configuration values from an XML resource file like this: ga_trackingId(string) - tracking id to send the reports to. Required. ga_sampleFrequency(string) - sampling rate in percents. Default is 100.0. It can be any value between 0.0 and 100.0. ga_autoActivityTracking(bool) - if true, views (Activities) will be tracked. Default is false. ga_anonymizeIp(bool) - if true, anonymizeIp will be set for each hit. Default is false. ga_reportUncaughtExceptions(bool) - if true, uncaught exceptions will be tracked. Default is false. NOTE: This value can only be set to true for a single Tracker. If specified for multiple Trackers, then the last one to be initialized will be used. ga_sessionTimeout(int) - time (in seconds) an app can stay in the background before a new session is started. Setting this to a negative number will result in a new session never being started. Default is 1800 seconds (30 minutes). If ga_autoActivityTracking is enabled, an alternate screen name can be specified to substitute for the full canonical @B_android#app#Activity_E@ class name. In order to specify an alternate screen name use an <screenName> element, with the name attribute specifying the full class name, and the screen name as element content.
